<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: for(Iterator<ImageReader> it = ImageIO.getImageReadersByFormatName("tiff").iterator(); it.hasNext(); ){
tiffreader = it.next();
iis = ImageIO.createImageInputStream(itemFile);
tiffreader.setInput(iis);
img = tiffreader.readAll(0, new TIFFImageReadParam());
f = new File(itemTargetDirectory.getAbsolutePath() + "/" + destFileName);
param = new J2KImageWriteParam();
param.setProgressionType("layer");
param.setFilter(J2KImageWriteParam.FILTER_53);
param.setNumDecompositionLevels(5);
jp2kwriter = (J2KImageWriter) ImageIO.getImageWritersByFormatName("JPEG 2000").iterator().next();
ios = ImageIO.createImageOutputStream(f);
jp2kwriter.setOutput(ios);
jp2kwriter.write(null, img, param);
}
<<<explanation>>>: The issue is that you are creating a new instance of the ImageReader and ImageWriter in every iteration of the loop. Instead, you should use the same instance of the ImageReader and ImageWriter in all iterations to ensure that the same settings are used for each file. Also, you should use the same instance of the ImageInputStream and ImageOutputStream for each file to ensure that the same settings are used for each file.
